newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bond prices close down, but off lows.
newsitem.headline: Danish bond prices close down, but off lows.

text.p: Danish bond prices succumbed to global market gloom on Tuesday, the first local trading day after a five-day Easter break, but showed signs of recovery, closing down but off the day's lows.
"The Danish market has done better than Germany and we should stabilise. There has been no panic but long-term jitters are sending investors into short-term paper," one dealer said.
The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 finished at 108.11, yielding 6.76 percent, down from Wednesday's 108.70 close but well up on its earlier 107.96.
The six percent mortgage bond due 2026 slipped 0.05 point to 86.70.
At the end of the day the crown stood at 3.8095 per mark strengthening somewhat from its early 3.8105.
The 10-year yield gap with Germany narrowed to 77 basis points from its opening 80 bp.
